title: How big is K-pop in Korea? - Quora

response.answer_text: As someone who’s actually been to Korea, I’ll say not as popular as you’d think. Most idols are known, but as a general public most people in Korea do not actively listen to Kpop. It’s very popular with a specific demographic of high schoolers, younger women or older men in some cases. A lot of Koreans prefer ballad type music such as the music you’d hear in a kdrama, or contemporary indie music like Coffee Boy. K-artists are also very popular with a wider demographic, and rap/pop music is HUGE with the younger generation, most of the fans you’ll find will be fans of Ariana Grande. But Kpop is not something most Koreans actively listen to. But the idols are well known in the public, aswell as their popular releases.

This is like saying is rap popular in America. And if you're still wondering, yes. Kpop is the most popular music in Korea, although Western pop is a close second. I hear that in Seoul you can see stores that sell idol-faced products. There are BTS, EXO and BlackPink product placements wherever you go in Seoul such as lots of Kbeauty (skin, hair, and makeup), food items (drinks, snacks) and whatnot. Because it's in their pop culture, I bet most Koreans listen to it without a second thought. However, a lot of them are fascinated with Western music (pop, R&B, rap).
